musicalLanguage.description: Sam Cooke's towering soul anthem, originally backed by sweeping strings. This piano arrangement captures the song's orchestral grandeur through wide-voiced chords and a soaring melody. The Bb major key has a warm, brassy quality, and the slow tempo allows every note to carry emotional weight.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse: 4 bars building from quiet to powerful, Chorus: 4 bars with the anthemic climax
keyMoments: Bar 1: The opening Bb major — quiet dignity before the storm.
Bars 5-6: The chorus lift — 'A change is gonna come' — the melody reaches its peak on F5.
Bar 8: The gentle descent and resolution — hope, not despair.
teachingGoals: Wide chord voicings to create orchestral fullness
Dynamic range — from pp to ff within 8 bars
Sustain pedal technique for legato bass movement
styleTips: This song demands emotional commitment — play every phrase like it matters
Build dynamics gradually — the climax in bar 6 should feel earned
Left hand chord changes should be seamless — use pedal to connect

measures.teachingNote: Bb major — barely audible. The song begins as a whisper.
F major — melody descends. Growing slightly louder.
Eb major — the climb begins. Each note steps higher with purpose.
F7 — dominant tension. The verse wants to break open into the chorus.
Chorus — Bb major soaring. The melody reaches up to F5.
Eb major — the emotional peak. Full tone, full heart.
F7 — beginning to settle. The melody descends with grace.
Bb major — home. A whole note of peace and resolve.
